docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 27 -- The United States-born wife of a Rome banker was dragged to her death from her seat beside her husband today when the door behind her opened and allowed the air to rush out of the pressurized plane in which they were flying...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 27 -- The United States-born wife of a Rome banker was dragged to her death from her seat beside her husband today when the door behind her opened and allowed the air to rush out of the pressurized plane in which they were flying at 12,000 feet near here.
docs.abstract: Sra M Cappellaro falls 12,000 ft into sea off Rio de Janeiro when Stratocruiser door flies open on Rio-Montevideo flight; cause not estab; like accidents recalled

headline.main: Woman Blown 12,000 Feet Into Sea As Airliner Door Flies Open Off Rio; Passenger Is Swept Out of Her Chair as She Sat Beside Husband

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 28 -- Three known casualties and numerous unrecorded ones resulted from a full-fledged blitz war started by the Uruguay team in the Trade Fair Hall Arena this afternoon after its 68-66 basketball defeat there at the hands of...
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, July 28 -- Three known casualties and numerous unrecorded ones resulted from a full-fledged blitz war started by the Uruguay team in the Trade Fair Hall Arena this afternoon after its 68-66 basketball defeat there at the hands of France.

headline.main: Uruguayans Attack U. S. Referee After Losing on Court to French; Farrell and Police Official Among Victims of Helsinki 'Blitz' -- Disciplinary Action Studied -- Russians in Press Box Row

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 28 -- With track and field completed, basketball and swimming attracted the major interest today in the games of the Fifteenth Olympiad and the United States scored notable victories in both.

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 29 (AP) -- The United States and Argentina emerged tonight as the class of the Olympic basketball tournament and almost certain contenders in the gold medal game scheduled for Saturday afternoon.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 29 -- By a vote of 9 to 5, with three abstentions, the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations accepted today a French proposal that the Human Rights Commission hold its 1953 session at Geneva, beginning April 6.

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 30 -- The United States suffered its first swimming defeat in two Olympics today in the men's 400-meter free-style, but gained its thirtieth gold medal of the games on the victory of Mrs. Pat Keller McCormick of Long Beach,...
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, July 30 -- The United States suffered its first swimming defeat in two Olympics today in the men's 400-meter free-style, but gained its thirtieth gold medal of the games on the victory of Mrs. Pat Keller McCormick of Long Beach, Calif., in springboard diving.
docs.abstract: summaries of events and unofficial point score

headline.main: Mrs. McCormick Wins Dive, but U. S. Suffers First Swim Loss in 2 Olympics; FRENCHMAN BEATS KONNO IN FAST 400 Boiteux, 19, Wins by Touch in 4:30.7 as First 7 in Swim Break Olympic Record U. S. ONE, THREE IN DIVE Mrs. McCormick, Mrs. Jensen Excel From Springboard in 30th American Triumph
